trans-unit.source: Bloom cannot find some of its own files, and cannot continue
trans-unit.target: Nti' nkanet qe junchaq teklx nak'ub'il aq'unb'il te Bloom ex nlay lajet taq'un

trans-unit.source: Your antivirus may have "quarantined" one or more Bloom files.
trans-unit.target: Qe kalol ti'j qe yab' tuj chemaj xin jaka "kyaj kyq'o'n tuj kyawinaq" jun mo txqantl nak'ub'il aq'unb'il te Bloom.

trans-unit.source: Your computer administrator may have your computer "locked down" to prevent bad things, but in such a way that Bloom could not place these files where they belong.
trans-unit.target: B'ala a ajka'yil aq'unb'il xk'utz'ib' ma "maqon te-te" Tu'ntzan mi'n tzaj tq'o'n qe nya' b'a'n, ma kub' tb'incha'n Bloom jlu' tu'ntzan tlaj nti' ma tz'ok tq'o'n qe nak'ub'il aq'unb'il tuj tu'melxix.

trans-unit.source: After you submit this report, we will contact you and help you work this out. In the meantime, here are some ideas:
trans-unit.target: Ok t-xi' samet tqanil aq'untl lu', jaka qoxq'ajte ti'je tu'n txi' qo'ne. At tzalu' ju'njun ximb'etz, tajlal n-naq'unane:

trans-unit.source: Run the Bloom installer again, and see if it starts up OK this time.
trans-unit.target: Q'o'n oka juntlmaj aj q'ob'il te Bloom, tu'n tok ka'yit qa ma' t-xi' qe' tuj tu'melxix.

trans-unit.source: If that doesn't fix it, it's time to talk to your anti-virus program. If the "Missing Files" section below shows any files which end in ".exe", consider "whitelisting" the Bloom program folder, which is at {{installFolder}}.
trans-unit.target: Qa nti'x ma b'ant ti'j, ma pon tumlal tu'n tku'x xpich'it aj ttxolil aq'unb'il xk'utz'ib' ti'jqe kalol yab' tuj chemaj xin. Qatzn tujqe k'loj "Nak'ub'il aq'unb'il atx taj" ("Missig Files") ma tzaj tyek'an qe nak'ub'il aq'unb'il nchi pon b'aj ti'j "exe", ximinxa tu'n tok tq'ona tkub'il aq'unb'il xk'utz'ib' te Bloom tuj "kyb'i saq ka'yin" ("white list"), ta' tuj{{installFolder}}.
Qe kalol ti'j qe yab' tuj chemaj xin Norton: Chaq'il te Symantec.

trans-unit.note: The former source text had an incorrect & following l=en_US in the href attribute value.

trans-unit.target: Juntl qe: Jayonxa "whitelist directory name-of-your-antivirus" ("ttenb'il kyb'i aq'unb'il saq chi ka'yin-te-tkolb'il yab' tuj chemaj xin") tuj Google

trans-unit.source: Run the Bloom installer again, and see if it starts up OK this time.
trans-unit.target: Q'on oka juntl maj q'ob'il te Bloom, tu'n tka'yina qa ma t-xi' qe' tuj tu'melxix.

trans-unit.source: You can also try and retrieve the part of Bloom that your anti-virus program took from it. For AVG, you need to find the AVG "options" menu, click "virus vault", click on the Bloom file in the vault, and click "restore". For a visual guide, see this image.
trans-unit.target: Ax ikyx jaka b'ant tzaj tzyet juntl maj aq'unab'il te Bloom aj xyukẍ tu'n tlaj ttxolil aq'unb'il xk'utz'ib' ti'j kalol yab' tuj chemajxin. Te AVG, ilx ti'j tu'n tkanet menú te "La' wiq tu'mel". B'inchanxa clic ti'j "Tenb'il kyi'jqe q'ol yab' tuj chemajxin" b'inchanxa clic ti'j nak'ub'il aq'unb'il te Bloom ta' tuj ttenb'il ex q'onxa clic tib'aj "Nxi' tb'inchan tib'". Tu'n tten jun yek'bitz te tilb'il, ka'yinxa atzan tib'lal.
